result.execSummary:
The defendant Carlin Scott Trollen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Carlin Scott Trollen is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Carlin Scott Trollen was found guilty of 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Restitution is determined to be zero.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Transcript: - Sentencing Hearing (Partial) held 07/06/2020

10:58 AM  Recorded in Buffalo County.  Defendant Carlin Scott Trollen appeared by Zoom technology from Pepin County Jail. Attorney Steven G. Richards appeared by Zoom technology for Defendant Carlin Scott Trollen. Attorney Jon D. Seifert appeared by phone means for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin.  DOC Agent appears by Zoom technology.  Court advises defendant of right to have this hearing in person and it's being conducted by Zoom today due to the current pandemic.  Mr. Trollen agrees to proceed today by Zoom technology.  Court finds Mr. Trollen knowingly and voluntarily waives his right to have this hearing in person.  Mr. Seifert informs victim not participating in this hearing but has submitted a victim impact statement.  Mr. Trollen and Attorney Richard confirms receipt of PSI.  Mr. Richards makes 3 corrections on page 14, page 16, and page 20, no other corrections or additions.  State addresses PSI and agreement to not go more than recommendation in PSI.  State recommends 18 years in the WI State Prison System, 10 yrs. IC, 8 yrs. ES, also to the agreement State recommends Court consider to run sentence concurrent with approximately 4 years left on the SD sentence with 266 days credit in this particular case.  Mr. Richards asks the court sentence Mr. Trollen to 10 yrs., 5 yrs IC, 5 yrs ES and to run concurrent to SD sentence.  Defendant addresses court.  Court sentences Mr. Trollen on count 1 to 18 years, 0 months.  IC is 10 years, 0 months.  Note 266 days credit.  ES will be 8 years 0 months, concurrent to the SD sentence.  Conditions of ES:  No contact with the victim or victims family, no contact with juveniles under the age of 18 without agent's approval; submit a DNA sample.  No restitution requested by State.  Court sets restitution at zero; complete sex offender assessment and follow through with recommended treatment and aftercare; coooperate with and complete any programming deemed necessary by the DOC; comply with the WI Sex Offender Registry Program; comply with any mental health treatment and take all prescribed mediation; not eligible for CIP, not eligible for SAP; advised of felony prohibitions; advised of appeal rights.

Sentencing hearing on July 6, 2020 at 11:00 am.  by Zoom - 
Pursuant to the Wisconsin Supreme Court Order issued March 22, 2020 and amended April 15, 2020 Re: Remote hearings during COVID-19 pandemic, this hearing is being held via video and telephone conferencing.  Instructions to join the hearing are provided with this notice.
Sentencing hearing on July 6, 2020 at 11:00 am.

10:00 AM Recorded from Buffalo County.  Case called.  Defendant Carlin Scott Trollen appeared by phone means from the Pepin County Jail.  Attorney Steven G. Richards appeared by phone means.  Attorney Jon D. Seifert appeared by phone means for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin.  Proceeding in which you have the right to be personally present in from of the court and with your counsel.  Mr. Trollen confirms he agrees to proceed telephonically.  Court - Mr. Trollen knowingly, voluntarily & intelligently waives his right to be personally present in this matter.  Mr. Seifert - Mr. Trollen will plead to count 1, State will dismiss count 2, parties ask for PSI.  Mr. Seifert confirms victim rights complied with.  Court advised Mr. Trollen of elements/max. penalties of count 1, rights giving up and felony prohibitions.  To the charge in count 1, Mr. Trollen pleads no contest.  Court having heard PH and found PC find a factual basis for plea, accepts plea and finds Mr. Trollen guilty.  Court will dismiss count 2 of Information and pursuant to plea negotiations and pursuant to recommendation will order a PSI.  Set this 60 days out.  Court asks Mr. Seifert to inform DOC of that date and prepare an order for PSI.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 6, 2020 at 11:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 14, 2020 at 10:00 am.

02:19 PM Attorney Steven G. Richards appeared by phone means for Defendant Carlin Scott Trollen.  Attorney Jon D. Seifert appeared by phone means for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin.  Parties believe arrived at a resolution, plead to 1 of 2 charges.  This call is to decide how we go about doing that under the current situation.  Would the court consider it by telephone and if you would Mr. Richards's client would do it by telephone.  Court's perspective if Mr. Richards and his client wishes to proceed absent personal appearance and do this by phone, court would accept and victims would need to be involved and have possibility to participate.  Mr. Richards talked with his client, PLQ/WRF on file, no issue doing by phone and Supreme Court giving us the record to do it.  Next week Tuesday.  Court wants Mr. Trollen to have sufficient time and willing to proceed and Mr. Seifert to make sure victim notified and able to participate if wishes.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 14, 2020 at 10:00 am.
Criminal Jury Trial Scheduling Order

Final pre-trial on June 23, 2020 at 03:30 pm.
Jury trial on August 10, 2020 at 09:00 am.

10:02 AM Recorded in Buffalo Co.  Court confirms parties can hear the Court.  Defendant Carlin Scott Trollen appeared by telephone.  Attorney Steven G. Richards appears by telephone.  Attorney Jon D. Seifert appeared by phone means for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin.  Motion for other acts has been filed by the State.  Court explains to Mr. Trollen what State is requesting the court to grant to allow other acts evidence at JT.  Court makes findings and will allow the admissabilty of other acts evidence as evidence in this case.  State wondering how the evidence and testimony will be allowed to be brought forth at a JT.  An alternative proposal presented.  Mr. Richards responds.  Court's ruling for State to only submit JOC without testimony would be unfairly prejudicial.  Trial scheduled for May 11 and given the Supreme Court Order, trial will need to be rescheduled.  JT rescheduled for August 10-11.  FPT be moved.  June 23 at 3:30 p.m.  Both parties to file any further motions by May 29th to be considered that day.  Court will do up a Scheduling Order.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 23, 2020 at 03:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for August 10, 2020 at 09:00 am.
Letter Re: Phone appearance on 03-31-2020
Notice of Motion and Motion Re: Other Acts Evidence with Attachment

Motion hearing on March 31, 2020 at 10:00 am.
Final pre-trial on April 14, 2020 at 10:00 am.
Jury trial on May 11, 2020 at 09:00 am.

03:35 PM Defendant Carlin Scott Trollen in court with attorney Steven G. Richards.  Defendant Carlin Scott Trollen in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Richard confirms receipt of the Information and reviewed with his client, waives further reading and enters NGP.  Court advises defendant of charges/max. penalties.  Not guilty pleas entered.  Parties request JT.  All motions be filed by 2/28; experts be named and filed by 2/28; Daubert challenges to be heard at the MH; Witness Lists to be filed 5 days before the MH; none standard jury instructions to be filed 5 days before FPT.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 14, 2020 at 10:00 am.  Motion hearing scheduled for March 31, 2020 at 10:00 am.  Jury trial scheduled for May 11, 2020 at 09:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Carlin Scott Trollen Amended from Information filed.
Current: Brown County Jail  22 Court Street, Aberdeen, WI 57401   (Effective: 12-03-2019)
Prior: Brown County Jail  22 Court Street, Aberdeen, SD 57401 United States
Arraignment on February 3, 2020 at 03:30 pm.

10:58 AM Defendant Carlin Scott Trollen in court with attorney Steven G. Richards.  Defendant Carlin Scott Trollen in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sworn by State Deputy Jeffrey Krisik & testifies.  Cross exam by Atty Richards.  Argument by Atty Richards regarding hearsay.  Court finds probable cause a felony was committed and binds Mr. Trollen over and DA to file Information within 30 days and leave to counsel to schedule an Arraignment.
Preliminary hearing on November 26, 2019 at 11:00 am.

10:49 AM Defendant Carlin Scott Trollen in court with attorney Steven G. Richards.  Defendant Carlin Scott Trollen in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Motion to dismiss filed by Mr. Trollen.  Mr. Richards notes the case was filed in 2015, Mr. Trollen been incarcerated in South Dakota since then; he wrote communications to resolve this case; there was a warrant with the case filed in 2015 and geographical restriction of statewide at that time.  Under WI Stats. 976.05 interstate detainer agreement.  214 Wis 2nd 372, issue here is whether or not there is a detainer against him, when that started.  State filed detainer motion, received here 9/19.  In the statute you site (3) there are requirements as you said, request for final disposition 976.05(3d).  Court's opinion believe the 180 days started when agreement on detainers signed 9/11.  Suggest to state, scheduling this matter within 6 mos. of 9/11.  Preliminary Hearing position?  There has not been an initial appearance.  Court advises Mr. Trollen of charge/max. penalties and rights and right to PH within 10 days since in custody.  Defendant WTL for PH.  Court finds Mr. Trollen, knowingly, voluntarily & intelligently WTL for PH.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 26, 2019 at 11:00 am.
Agreement on Detainers from DOC Sioux Falls, SD
Motion hearing on October 15, 2019 at 11:00 am.
Defendant's Motion to Dismiss

records.addlTxt: Atty Steven Richards appt'd.
Proposed Order to Dismiss Ceclined.  The court made a request of the DA for a statement of victim agreement with the dismissal, absent that the court will not sign the proposed order.

Jon D. Seifert, DA for Pepin County moves to dismiss on The basis for said Motion is, the defendant has other legal entanglements in the State of South Dakota. The defendant has been sentenced to 13 years of confinement in the South Dakota State Prison system the estimated release date for him is 3/28/2025.
Letter from Carlin Trollen.  Now located in the South Dakota State Prison
